input_text:
Job Title: Marketing Specialist

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
Etna Interactive, a remote-first marketing agency based in San Luis Obispo, CA, is hiring a *remote Marketing Specialist with a minimum of 2 years of related professional experience or educational background. (*must live in Arizona, California, Colorado, Georgia, Michigan, or Washington)
Marketing Specialist
Why should you choose Etna?We live our valuesFlexible and remote work culture that supports work / life balanceProgressive paid time off system where taking vacations and time off is encouragedOur peopleEveryone’s favorite part of working here is the people they work withWe are scrappy, curious problem-solversWe are considerate, fair, good humansWe are fun and pun-loving, passionate about what we doWe are tenacious, committed, life-long learnersWe care for our peopleWe invest time – 10% of our time is spent in learningWe invest resources – leaders devote 25% of their time to team member personal developmentAnd we provide uncommonly good benefits100% employer-sponsored medical coverageA 401(K) plan with an employer matching componentEmployer-sponsored long-term disability insurance
What does a Marketing Specialist at Etna do?Everything from high-value link building to social media advertising to email production to technical tasks. And then some. 
As a Marketing Specialist, you will:Be their voice.Represent our clients as you manage their social media and strengthen their reputations through online platforms.Coach our clients to improve their efforts in tandem with ours or manage some marketing in-house.Research clients’ competitors to better understand the landscape and how to most effectively position them.Generate opportunities.Understand the multiple channels working together for each client and the best ways to integrate them.Cultivate valuable backlink profiles, dial in local SEO for clients across North America, collaborate with creative and technology teams to elevate on site SEO.Grow at your pace.Discover something that doesn’t make sense? Ask questions & dig in. Increase your understanding or resolve a problem.Have an idea for a product that would fulfill a need? Pitch it and sell the product team on it so you can bring it to life.Do you value title and role growth? Work with your leaders to develop your skills and request a promotion when you’re ready.
Ideally, a new Marketing Specialist will have a base foundation of digital marketing knowledge and experience. They know what SEO is and why it’s important. The most successful Etnan's stay curious and like solving the many challenges and puzzles that come our way.
Marketing Specialists work both independently and collaboratively on the execution of the marketing. They provide recommendations and strategic input while primarily staying focused on project completion to achieve and exceed our clients’ marketing goals.
What will I learn?How to use a good pun.Photography tips and tricks.More than you ever imagined about the plastic surgery world.Collaboration, resourcefulness, and expertise.Cross-training on a range of tactics, including link building, local SEO, social media, paid search, and communication — with the goal of developing into a “T-shaped marketer” (Google it).
We embrace change as opportunity to learn and develop our skills, products, and services. 
Why should Etna choose you?
Because our small agency has made a big name for itself in the medical marketing space, our clients expect and truly deserve the attention of an experienced professional.
To be an Etnan, you must...Fit our culture.Communicate and work with team members and clients in a positive, professional, and productive manner.Own your responsibilities by establishing, adapting, and communicating timelines.Build positive relationships and maintain a sense of humor and optimistic attitude.Be agile and able to "think on your feet" while managing competing priorities.Recognize where and how to add value to projects and proactively participate.Be skilled in the basics.Have knowledge and experience using Windows Operating System, Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Excel. (Or be a proactive fast learner!)Know your resources including common web browsers, web sites such as Google Analytics and Wayback Machine.Have a healthy obsession with details and processes, with an understanding of and appreciation for the law of diminishing returns.Be a marketer.While a degree in marketing is great, relevant work experience is highly valued.Ask good questions.Bring solutions – to Etna, to our clients, and to their patients.
We will ask the most compelling candidates to complete an at-home skills assessment; exceptional performance on the assessment will earn you an interview.
We have a special interest in finding candidates with excellent organization and communication skills. While a strong skill set and innate intelligence will get you in the door, a kind personality and the ability to fit in with our team here at Etna are necessary traits of a successful applicant.Since 2002, Etna Interactive has helped clinical and aesthetic practices, hospitals, insurance companies, and medical device manufacturers educate and attract new patients. Our small firm has made a big name for itself in the medical marketing industry, and our clients expect the attention of an experienced professional at every step.
Application Instructions: To APPLY, please submit your resume and a cover letter (PDF preferred) at https://www.etnainteractive.com/about/careers/marketing-specialist/
Etna Interactive provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Etna Interactive complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Experience Level (if available): None
